intro: Draba winterbottomii, commonly known as the winterbottom's rockcress, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. This species typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and appear in clusters, often blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit and basal leaves, which are often covered in fine hairs.
